title: Agbamoni
author: Agbamoni
content: "The Englishman would say, 'If you want to hide something from a black man, put it in a book.'"Let me tell you something nobody else will tell you: hunger is a very good thing. Our people do not know this; that is why they remain poor. The feeling pushes you to do something that you did not imagine you could do before. You are very lucky to be chosen. This thing that Yinka has brought you people for is not for everyone"Over the past few weeks, I have been spending time reading new books and exploring the internet for valuable insights. I found the book "My Mind Is No Longer Here" to be a very intriguing read. I spend 8 hours a day on the forum and 3 hours reading this book. It has unveiled secrets and untold wisdom. My knowledge has broadened, and I feel it would be nice to share with my fellow brothers. Some of us might have already read it, but regardless, let this thread also serve as a reminder so we won't forget the ethics we have learned from this book.
